p: pH modifies the activity of antiviral medications. Many proteins undergo conformational changes of their tertiary and quaternary structure induced by ionic changes (Ca 2+, H +, Fe 2+ and Mn +) and pH modifications. Such modifications are documented for the main protease (Mpro) of SARS-CoV2 during its binding to protease inhibitors at pH 4.0-8.0, and it was shown that they were pH-dependent, with different binding energy (stability of protein complex) and specific bonding type/atom interaction ( 103).
